channel.title: In need of assistance
channel.description:
I recently purchased hosting through hawkhost and I would like to create a website, but my experience in website creating is limited. Also, I'd like to have a home page with built in forums, and donation re-directs as well. I am not sure if this is possible without a great deal of work, but I would like the home page to be unique, not a copy, not a rip from another rsps, so if you can help or suggest somewhere to go I would really appreciate it.
Thanks,
Suseto Contentzpk Owner

item.title: In need of assistance
item.dc:creator: @suseto21 suseto21
item.description:
@suseto21 wrote:

I got rid of a lot of the white, but I cannot find a way to change the color of the font or remove the white from the slideshow. http://contentzpk.net/conc

Edit: I removed the slideshow and added a few paypal donate links as well as the client download link at the top of the page and the forums link at the bottom. Suggestions?

Read full topic

item.title: In need of assistance

item.description:
@suseto wrote:

Probably a ignorant question, but how exactly do I remove the white elements from the website within the slide show, paypal button etc etc

Read full topic

item.title: In need of assistance
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

suseto:

Looks like poo lol…but here is what i got soo far. http://contentzpk.net/conc/

Ok so what I’d personally do now is remove the white background around some of your elements.

I’d then make a container around the content of the page and add a 20% transparent grey background that makes it easier to read the writing on the page. (hint - CSS/Opacity)

Then look at getting higher res images that look nice in the resolution they’re displayed.

We’ll take it from there

Read full topic

item.title: In need of assistance
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

suseto:

I can install that, but i’m unsure of which one to choose. The most user friendly i guess is what im asking.

Probably WordPress or Joomla are the most user friendly.

There is still quite a bit of effort and work involved with creating it on your side though. It’s not going to be easy doing it yourself. It’s worth it, I started website developing about 6 years ago and now I own my own company doing it, I’m fully self taught. If someone like me can do it then you can too.

Read full topic
